inclusion.criterion: Symptomatic renal calculi and diameter smaller than 25mm
inclusion.label: met
inclusion.evidence: non-obstructing stone in the L ureter, no evidence of urethral strictures

exclusion.criterion: Ureteral calculi or urinary tract anomalies, stricture or obstruction
exclusion.label: not_met
exclusion.evidence: non-obstructing stone in the L ureter

exclusion.criterion: Patients with congenital anomalies, e.g. ectopic kidney, polycystic
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: Patients who underwent transplant or urinary diversion
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: Patient undergoing any other surgical procedure during the same admission.
exclusion.label: not_met

notes: 62 yo male with hx of CVA, neurogenic bladder with indwelling suprapubic catheter with multiple prior admissions for UTIs, altered mental status, and urosepsis presents to the hospital in urosepsis now resolved after treatment with vanc/meropenem. Per CT there is a non-obstructing stone in the L ureter, no evidence of urethral strictures.
